column3: Department of Archaeology, Classics and Egyptology
column5: This MSc programme concentrates on science-based archaeology and is ideal for you if you want to become post-excavation or artefact specialists in the museum or commercial sectors.INTRODUCTIONThere are two pathways to choose from: Artefact, and Landscape and Environment. Both pathways are suitable if you are a graduate in archaeology or a science subject and want to start or further your career in these exciting fields.The programme is also useful preparation for further academic research and the skills you’ll gain, such as problem-solving and team work, will be attractive to any employer.
column7: UK fees (applies to Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland) Full-time place, per year - £10,350 Part-time place, per year - £5,175  International fees Full-time place, per year - £21,150 Part-time place, per year - £10,575
column9: 1 year full time, 2 years part time
